description.narrative: (Zambia): .The Community Forests Program (CFP) implements Zambia's first landscape-level carbon initiative under a subnational country-led Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation (REDD+) project. Over five years, CFP will establish 700,000 hectares of REDD+ protected area to facilitate long-term relationships between forest-dependent communities and key public and private stakeholders on forested, but heavily threatened, public and customary lands. During FY 2016, the activity will achieve 250,000 hectares under 30-year participatory forest conservation management plans, establish working REDD+ protected areas, monitor and verify forest areas needed to produce marketable carbon credits, strengthen community-based governance and protection of natural resources and biodiversity, and increase alternative rural livelihoods for villages in its zone of influence. .
